__prompts__.project_name: What is the name of this project? (This will be used as the project name in the README, etc)
__prompts__.project_slug: Name the project root directory. (This will be used as the project folder)
__prompts__.code_directory: Name the directory containing python code
__prompts__.cluster: Will this project use a remote computing cluster? (Updates README and provides sample files)
__prompts__.docker: Will this project use Docker containers? (Updates the README and adds sample files)

data_dir.__prompt__: Where will this project store its data?
data_dir.none: none: DATA_DIR will not be set
data_dir.local: local: DATA_DIR will be [project_root]/data/, which will be added to .gitignore
data_dir.github: github: DATA_DIR will be [project_root]/data/ (does not support >100MB)
data_dir.box: box: DATA_DIR will be ~/Library/CloudStorage/Box-Box/, which is the default location for Box files on macOS

__prompts__.examples: Would you like to populate the repository with some example code?
__prompts__.bsd: Would you like to use DSI's default license (BSD-3)?
__prompts__.ann: Would you like to require type annotations in ruff?
